NUMBEROFFIELDS.WHAT: Displays the count of fields in the dataset.
NUMBEROFFIELDS.WHY: In order to understand the Dataset field quantity and distribution

SPIDERCHART.WHAT: A radial chart that shows data in terms of multiple variables. decribe what it does more.
SPIDERCHART.WHY: Evaluate multiple metrics for a single record to determine data quality and consistency.

NUMBEROFRECORDS.WHAT: Displays the count of Records in the dataset.
NUMBEROFRECORDS.WHY: In order to understand the Dataset size

bubble-chart.WHAT: Visualises the categorical features within a column as bubbles.
bubble-chart.WHY: Use to identify categorical distribution. Large bubbles may indicate asimetric data points needing normalisation.

cardinality.WHAT: Shows the uniqueness of data by representing the number of distinct values in a column.
cardinality.WHY: Helpful for understanding when to collapse rare categories or when binning might be necessary for numeric to categorical conversions.

NUMBEROFFIELDS.WHAT: Displays the count of fields in the dataset.
